snippet: Drowning is almost entirely preventable, and teaching even basic swimming skills can help keep young people safe.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on the lack of swimming instruction in the New York City public school system; says that drowning is almost entirely preventable, and teaching even basic swimming skills could help keep young people safe in a city with so many public pools.
lead_paragraph: Drowning is almost entirely preventable, and teaching even basic swimming skills can help keep young people safe.

headline.seo: Schools Have Abandoned a Skill, Swimming Education, That Could Save Lives
